paper_title.en: Acetate reduction synthesis of Sr2Si5N8:Eu2+ phosphor and its luminescence properties

description.en: A novel synthesis method was developed for the efficient red phosphor, Eu2+-activated Sr2Si5N8, by employing the strontium acetate as both the reducing agent and strontium source. The phase purity of final product was strongly dependent on the heating rate of the precursors. Sr2Si5N8:Eu2+ (2 at%) phosphor presented a broadband excitation spectrum in the range 300-500 nm. matching well with the blue emission (400/460 nm) of current InGaN light-emitting diodes (LEDs). The red emission peaking at 619 nm gave the relatively high (about 155%) intensity compared with the Y3Al5O12 (YAG) (P46-Y3) standard phosphor. In addition, the saturated chromatic coordinates (0.638, 0.359) allowed it a promising candidate as a red phosphor in white LEDs application for illumination or display. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier B.V.

paper_title.en: Acetate reduction synthesis of Sr2Si5N8:Eu2+ phosphor and its luminescence properties

description.en: A novel synthesis method was developed for the efficient red phosphor, Eu2+-activated Sr2Si5N8, by employing the strontium acetate as both the reducing agent and strontium source. The phase purity of final product was strongly dependent on the heating rate of the precursors. Sr2Si5N8:Eu2+ (2 at%) phosphor presented a broadband excitation spectrum in the range 300-500 nm. matching well with the blue emission (400/460 nm) of current InGaN light-emitting diodes (LEDs). The red emission peaking at 619 nm gave the relatively high (about 155%) intensity compared with the Y3Al5O12 (YAG) (P46-Y3) standard phosphor. In addition, the saturated chromatic coordinates (0.638, 0.359) allowed it a promising candidate as a red phosphor in white LEDs application for illumination or display. (C) 2009 Published by Elsevier B.V.

paper_title.en: Microstructure analysis of Nd-Fe-B sintered magnets improved by Tb-metal vapour sorption

description.en: P>Behaviours of constituent elements in the Nd-Fe-B sintered magnets improved by Tb-metal vapour sorption have been investigated by using an analytical transmission microscopy. It was found that a triple junction of the grain boundaries consists of fine Nd-O crystalline and amorphous phase. The energy dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDS) analysis showed that the amorphous phase mainly consists of Co, Nd and Tb. The Tb-treatment causes the formation of the amorphous Co-Nd(Tb) wetting-layer phase which wraps each Nd(2)Fe(14)B grain. The results suggest that the wrapped structure prevents the nucleation of magnetic reversed domains and then improves significantly the coercivity of the magnet.

paper_title.en: Microstructure analysis of Nd-Fe-B sintered magnets improved by Tb-metal vapour sorption

description.en: P>Behaviours of constituent elements in the Nd-Fe-B sintered magnets improved by Tb-metal vapour sorption have been investigated by using an analytical transmission microscopy. It was found that a triple junction of the grain boundaries consists of fine Nd-O crystalline and amorphous phase. The results suggest that the wrapped structure prevents the nucleation of magnetic reversed domains and then improves significantly the coercivity of the magnet.

paper_title.en: Lean NOx Reduction by Hydrogen over Pt-Supported Rare Earth Oxide Catalysts and Their In Situ DRIFTs Study

description.en: The Pt-supported rare earth oxide (CeO2, Pr6O11, Eu2O3, and Gd2O3) catalysts were prepared and their selective catalytic reduction (SCR) characteristics for NOx using hydrogen were investigated under 10vol% excess oxygen conditions. Among them, only the Pt/CeO2 catalyst provided good NO conversion (ca. 80%) with ca. 40% N-2 selectivity. Other catalysts hardly showed NOx reduction activity due to the high solid basicity Of Supporting materials. In situ diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy (DRIFTs) measurements for the Pt/CeO2 catalyst were performed to obtain the specific adsorption bands assigned to NO3- species, indicating that NOx reduction proceeds via formation of such nitrate.

publication_name.en: BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Lean NOx Reduction by Hydrogen over Pt-Supported Rare Earth Oxide Catalysts and Their In Situ DRIFTs Study

description.en: The Pt-supported rare earth oxide (CeO2, Pr6O11, Eu2O3, and Gd2O3) catalysts were prepared and their selective catalytic reduction (SCR) characteristics for NOx using hydrogen were investigated under 10vol% excess oxygen conditions. publication_name.en: BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Influence of supported-metal characteristics on deNO(x) catalytic activity over Pt/CeO2

description.en: Fine Pt Particles were loaded on the CeO2 supports with various specific Surface areas by an incipient wetness method or a solvothermal one, and their catalytic properties for the NOx reduction by hydrogen were tested. The Pt/CeO2 catalysts prepared by the solvothermal method provided higher activity than those by the impregnation one when using the CeO2 support with high Surface area. Each CeO2 supports and Pt particles prepared by the solvothermal method did not show the good catalytic activity singly. However the catalysts obtained by physically mixing Pt particles with the CeO2 supports gave excellent NOx conversion of ca. 80% with relative high N-2 selectivity (75%). (C) 2009 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Electromagnetic wave absorption properties of Fe3C/carbon nanocomposites prepared by a CVD method

description.en: Dendrite-shaped iron nanowires with 50-200 nm in diameter and 10-20 mm in length were prepared by the CVD method from Fe(CO)(5) as a starting source. Ethanol was cracked on the surface of the resultant iron nanowires to form the Fe3C/carbon nanocomposites, in which nanosized carbon beads covered the surface of Fe3C. Resin compact of the resultant Fe3C/carbon nanocomposites had excellent electromagnetic wave absorption ability in the range of 0.9-9.0 GHz, and such available absorption range more enhanced compared to that observed on the resin compact prepared from the original iron nanowires by the hybridization of magnetic (Fe3C) and dielectric (carbon) materials. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS

paper_title.en: Novel rare earth recovery process on Nd-Fe-B magnet scrap by selective chlorination using NH(4)Cl

description.en: Extraction of rare earth elements from the Nd-Fe-B magnet scraps through the chlorination with NH(4)Cl was performed to study the effective process for reusing metal iron as well as rare earths. The Nd(2)Fe(14)B primary phase was selectively converted to NdCl(3) in ca. 90% yield, together with alpha-Fe and Fe-B solid residues by chlorinating at 573 K for 3 h. The resin compacts prepared from the resultant solid residues mainly composed of the alpha-Fe phase provided the good electromagnetic wave absorption properties. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Grain Boundary Phase Formation and Magnetic Properties of NdFeB/Nd Multilayered Films

description.en: Two kinds of NdFeB singlelayered and NdFeB/Nd multilayered films were prepared on each Mo substrate using a three-dimensional sputtering system. The singlelayered films annealed at 1073 K consisted of Nd(2)Fe(14)B main phase together with soft magnetic alpha-Fe phase as an impurity and only showed poor magnetic properties. However, for the multilayered films, the Nd-rich grain boundary phase among the Nd(2)Fe(14)B particles was more effectively formed in a similar manner as conventional NdFeB sintered magnets, so that the alpha-Fe impurity phase was completely disappeared and the numbers of surface defects on the main phase particles were decreased. The resultant multilayered film magnets of [NdFeB (650 nm)/Nd (10 nm)](4) gave high H(cJ) values around 1.58 MA/m for B(r) approximate to 1.21 T and (BH)(max) approximate to 279 kJ/m(3), respectively. (C) 2009 The Japan Society of Applied Physics

Low-temperature Hydrogen-selective Catalytic Reduction of NOx on Pt/Sulfated-ZrO2 Catalysts under Excess Oxygen Conditions

description.en: Platinum catalyst., supported on sulfated zirconia powders highly promote the hydrogen-selective catalytic reduction (H2SCR) of NOx at 100 degrees C with formation of ammonia intermediate species derived front protons of the sulfonate groups fixed as superacid sites on the surface, which are detected by in situ DRIFTs measurements.

paper_title.en: Hydrogen Selective Catalytic Reduction of NOx Assisted by In Situ Ammonia Formation over Pt Catalyst Supported on Fe-doped Tin Phosphate

description.en: In Situ formation of ammonia and NOx reduction with high N-2 selectivity based on it were observed in the hydrogen selective catalytic reduction (H-2-SCR) of NOx over a platinum catalyst supported on a Fe-doped SnP2O7 powder with strong solid acidity even under conditions of high oxygen contents of about 10 vol %.
